attributes.action: Make tenant liable for damage to property and unpaid rent faster eviction
attributes.additional_details: The single mother was on benefits , was using her universal credit for holidays, no rent for over 10 months, trashed house. I have been left stranded to re-pay the mortgage, the court fees, the solicitor fees and I had to pay 5000 GBP to refurbish the place as well.  She was advised by the council to stay put till the end she didn't even handover key. We need a rapid eviction process for people that behave in such manner and they should be held liable for the damages and unpaid rent.
attributes.background: Rented property, from July 2018 to April 2019 tenant stopped paying rent, I had to follow the process from section 8,21, to court application via bailifs the whole process took 10 months and they also trashed the property. To date I got 0 GBP back and over 15 000 GBP out of pocket !

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Damage to property and unpaid rent are already enforceable by the courts. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly how you would like the law to change, or explaining how evictions should be made easier, if that is what you would like to do.
